document.docTitle: Caligoneus cavernicola Komai & Fujita 2018, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A new genus and new species of alpheid shrimp from a marine cave in the Ryukyu Islands, Japan, with additional record of Salmoneus antricola Komai, Yamada & Yunokawa, 2015 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Caridea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new genus and new species of alpheid shrimp from a marine cave in the Ryukyu Islands, Japan, with additional record of Salmoneus antricola Komai, Yamada & Yunokawa, 2015 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Caridea)

subSubSection.paragraph: [New Japanese name: Kurayami-teppou-ebi] Figs 1–5

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Material examined
. Holotype : CBM-ZC 14136, ovigerous individual (cl 5.7 mm ), unnamed cave (sometimes called as “ Ohoba No. 2 Cave ”), Ie Island , Okinawa Islands, Ryukyu Islands , Japan ,
12 m
,
18 July 2015
, SCUBA diving, coll. K. Yunokawa & Y. Fujita.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes : RUMF-ZC-02733, non-ovigerous individual (cl 5.6 mm ), same data as holotype; CBM-ZC 14137, ovigerous individual (cl 5.8 mm ), same locality as holotype ,
12 m
,
3 August 2015
, SCUBA diving, coll. K. Yunokawa
;
RUMF-ZC-04569, non-ovigerous individual (cl 5.7 mm ), same locality as holotype,
12 m
,
23 June 2017
, SCUBA diving, coll. Y. Fujita
;
RUMF-ZC-04570, ovigerous individual (cl 5.7 mm ), same data as RUMF-ZC 0 4569.
Non-type: RUMF-ZC-04568, non-ovigerous individual (cl 6.0 mm; damaged for DNA extraction), same data as RUMF-ZC 0 4569.

Description.
Holotype
. Body ( Fig. 1 ) moderately stout. Rostrum ( Fig. 2A–C ) not reaching distal margin of article 1 of antennular peduncle, trigonal in cross-section with carinate dorsal and lateral margins, longer than wide at base, directed forward; tip sharply pointed; dorsal mid-line somewhat elevated, mid-dorsal carina extending to gastric region beyond postrostral spine; lateral carina not reaching rostral apex, merging into orbital margin; ventral surface slightly convex but not medially carinate, unarmed or armed with 1 minute subdistal spine; lateral margins nearly straight in dorsal view; ventral surface unarmed. Carapace ( Figs. 1 , 2A–C ) glabrous, with 1 small middorsal spine at postrostral position; anterolateral margin gently sinuous, with small extra-orbital spine lateral to eyestalk; cardiac notch shallow; orbital spine directed forward; pterygostomial angle broadly rounded.
Epistomial sclerites unarmed. Labrum with non-crested median lobe.

FIGURE 1.
Caligoneus cavernicola
n.gen., n. sp.
, holotype, CBM-ZC 14136, ovigerous individual (cl 5.7 mm), habitus in lateral view (antennular and antennal flagella partially omitted).

FIGURE 2.
Caligoneus cavernicola
n.gen., n. sp.
A, C–J, holotype, CBM-ZC 14136, ovigerous individual (cl 5.7 mm); B, paratype, CBM-ZC 14137, ovigerous individual (cl 5.8 mm). A, anterior part of carapace and cephalic appendages, lateral view (antennular and antennal flagella partially omitted); B, anterior part of carapace, lateral view; C, anterior part of carapace and cephalic appendages, dorsal view; D, telson and right uropod, dorsal view (marginal setae on uropodal rami partially omitted); E, posterior end of telson, dorsal view; F, left antennal peduncle, ventral view (marginal setae on scaphocerite omitted); G, left pleopod 1, dorsal view; H, same, endopod, dorsomesial view; I, left pleopod 2, dorsal view; J, same, appendices interna and masculina, dorsal view.

FIGURE 3.
Caligoneus cavernicola
n.gen., n. sp.
, holotype, CBM-ZC 14136, ovigerous individual (cl 5.7 mm), mouthparts dissected from left side. A, mandible, internal view; B, same, external view; C, same, incisor process, distal surface; D, maxillule (coxal endite missing); E, maxilla; F, maxilliped 1; G, same, lateral view of exopod and endopod; H, maxilliped 2.

FIGURE 4.
Caligoneus cavernicola
n.gen., n. sp.
, holotype, CBM-ZC 14136, ovigerous individual (cl 5.7 mm). A, left maxilliped 3, lateral view; B, same, coxa and proximal part of antepenultimate article, dorsal view; C, left pereopod 1 (= cheliped), lateral view; D, same, chela, extensor view; E, right pereopod 1 (= cheliped), lateral view; F, same, chela, extensor view; G, left pereopod 2, lateral view; H, left pereopod 3, lateral view; I, same, distal part of propodus and dactylus, lateral view; J, left pereopod 4, lateral view; K, left pereopod 5, lateral view; L, same, distal part of propodus and dactylus, lateral view.

FIGURE 5.
Caligoneus cavernicola
n.gen. , n. sp.
, general habitus and colour in life. A, holotype, CBM-ZC 14136, ovigerous individual (cl 5.7 mm); B, paratype, RUMF-ZC-02733, non-ovigerous individual (cl 5.6 mm).

subSubSection.paragraph: Eggs at stage near hatching 0.9× 0.5 mm .

Variation . The remaining five specimens (four paratypes and one non-type) are generally very similar to the holotype . One of them ( paratype , CBM-ZC 14137) has two postrostral spines ( Fig. 2B ), whilst the other four have one postrostral spine, as in the holotype . In three specimens (two paratypes , RUMF-ZC 0 4569, 0 4570, and one non-type, RUMF-ZC 04568), the rostrum has a minuscule subdistal tooth on the ventral margin, such a tooth being absent in the holotype and the remaining two paratypes (CBM-ZC 14137, RUMF-ZC-02733). The ischia of the pereopods 1 and 2 are quite variable in the armature, having four to six and three or four spiniform setae, respectively. The ischium of the pereopod 3 can be either unarmed [ holotype and two paratypes (CBM-ZC 14137, RUMF-ZC-02733)] or armed with one or two spiniform setae [two paratypes ( RUMF-ZC 0 4569, 04570) and one non-type ( RUMF-ZC 04568)]. Eggs in non-eyed stage measure 0.7× 0.4 mm .

Distribution . At present known only from a marine cave off Ie Island , Okinawa Islands, Japan , at depths of
12– 17 m
.

Habitat. The type locality of
Caligoneus cavernicola
n. sp.
is a deep marine cave located on a reef slope off northeastern coast of Ie Island . The entrance to the cave lies at a depth of about 17 m below the sea level. The interior of the cave is 45 m long and bifurcated into “main tube” and “large hall” at about 30 m from the entrance. The “large hall” is about 200 m 2 and its height to the roof is about 12 m (the roof is about 8 m below the sea level). Shrimps were mostly found in small holes inside the “large hall”. The syntopic decapod fauna includes
Salmoneus antricola
(Caridea: Alpheidae ),
Bresilia rufioculus Komai & Yamada, 2011
(Caridea: Bresiliidae ),
Catoptrus iejima Fujita & Naruse, 2011
(Brachyura: Portunidae ),
Atoportunus gustavi Ng & Takeda, 2003
(Brachyura: Portunidae ), and
Lipkemera iejima Naruse & Fujita, 2015
( Xanthidae ).
Etymology . Named after the cave habitat of the new species, the Latin cavern (= cave) and –cola (suffix, meaning dweller). Used as a noun in apposition.

Remarks . Among the six specimens examined, three are ovigerous. Like species of
Salmoneus
and
Triacanthoneus
, all individuals including the ovigerous ones have a well-developed appendix masculina just next to the appendix interna ( Fig. 2J ), on the pleopod 2, indicating a possibility of some form of hermaphroditism. Several morphological features of the new species clearly represent adaptations to cave environments, such as the reduced cornea located at the distolateral portion of the eyestalk and the very slender elongate pereopods 3–5.
